sections.name: Clay Effigy
Clay Shards
sections.text: The remains of clay effigies are worth more to archaeologists and scholars than to merchants. The magnificent treasures often guarded by these ancient wardens, however, are another matter entirely.

Traditionally, clay effigies are crafted in the image of a deity and used as guardians of tombs or sacred crypts. Clay effigies have the power to lay curses upon their victims as punishment for intrusion, leading many to believe that these oft-ancient constructs have a touch of the divine in them. Out of an abundance of caution, superstitious folk still tread lightly around elaborate or particularly well-crafted statues that resemble clay effigies even in the slightest.  
  
 For some clay effigies, this divine protection goes deeper. Even though deities rarely have the time to monitor their effigies, lesser divine servants are sometimes tasked with watching over an effigy. When the effigy is damaged, these guardians can sense it. The most precious effigies are layered with rituals that summon their guardians directly. Experienced tomb robbers learn to spot such markings from afar, so as to be forewarned of any divine interference in the area.  
  
 Although often assigned to protect valuable religious relics and other treasure, clay effigies' size and heavy movements make them ill-suited to stand guard among fragile items. Entire treasuries have been totally ruined by clumsy battles, so crafters do well to make sure their treasures are secured in sturdy containers—or otherwise place the effigy on the other side of the door from the treasures they wish to protect.

traits.name: Uncommon
traits.text: Something of uncommon rarity requires special training or comes from a particular culture or part of the world. Some character choices give access to uncommon options, and the GM can choose to allow access for anyone. Less is known about uncommon creatures than common creatures. They typically can't be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creature is increased by 2.

traits.name: Construct
traits.text: A construct is an artificial creature empowered by a force other than vitality or void.

traits.name: Mindless
traits.text: A mindless creature has either programmed or rudimentary mental attributes. Most, if not all, of their mental attribute modifiers are –5. They are immune to all mental effects.

interaction_abilities.name: Sacred Art
interaction_abilities.text: The creator of a clay effigy can dedicate the effigy to a deity while constructing it. If the deity allows a divine sanctification, the effigy is sanctified to that deity, gaining the holy or unholy trait as appropriate.

automatic_abilities.name: Effigy's Curse

traits.name: Curse
traits.text: A curse is an effect that places some long-term affliction on a creature. Curses are always magical and are typically the result of a spell or trap. Effects with this trait can be removed only by effects that specifically target curses.

traits.name: Divine
traits.text:
This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to divine magic.

automatic_abilities.text: When a creature damages the clay effigy, it must succeed at a DC 27 Will save or be afflicted with the effigy's curse. The accursed becomes fatigued when it carries part of the effigy or any item the effigy was assigned to guard. This fatigue can't be removed until the creature has given up such items for at least 24 hours.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: This weapon can be used to attack enemies up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent enemies. For creatures with reach, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

traits.name: Sanctified
traits.text: If you are holy or unholy, your sanctified actions and spells gain the same trait.

ability.name: Cast Out

traits.name: Divine
traits.text:
This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to divine magic.

traits.name: Sanctified
traits.text: If you are holy or unholy, your sanctified actions and spells gain the same trait.

traits.name: Spirit
traits.text: Effects with this trait can affect creatures with spiritual essence and might deal spirit damage. A creature with this trait is defined by its spiritual essence. Spirit creatures often lack a material form.

ability.failure: The creature takes full damage and 3d6 persistent spirit damage. The persistent damage ends if the creature moves over 60 feet from the clay effigy or the effigy is destroyed.
ability.critical_failure: As failure, except the persistent damage is increased to 6d6.
ability.text: A 20-foot emanation of spiritual energy pushes against intruders, as though trying to drive their souls away. Each creature in the area takes 8d6 spirit damage depending on a DC 29 Will save. The clay effigy can't Cast Out again for 1d4 rounds.

ability.name: Heavy Stride
ability.text: The clay effigy Strides and can move through the spaces of Medium and smaller creatures. Each creature it moves through must succeed at a DC 29 Reflex save or be knocked prone.
